subject: Business
title: Building Diverse Teams
description: A short lesson to help you apply Building Diverse Teams.

hook.text: A team of identical thinkers agrees fast but misses blind spots. A diverse team argues but catches everything.

buildup.text: Cognitive diversity â€” different thinking styles, backgrounds, and perspectives â€” improves group decision-making.

discovery.text: McKinsey found companies in the top quartile for diversity are 35% more likely to outperform their peers financially.

twist.text: Diversity without inclusion is useless. Hiring different people means nothing if only one perspective is heard.

climax.text: The leader's job: create structures where dissenting voices are actively invited and genuinely considered.

punchline.text: Sameness is comfortable. Difference is productive.

quiz.question: Why is diversity alone not enough for better team performance?
options: Without inclusion, diverse perspectives go unheard
Diverse teams always disagree too much
Diversity only matters in large companies
